Package edu.ncsu.csc216.requirements_manager.model.manager

Class RequirementsManager

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.requirements_manager.model.manager.RequirementsManager
public class RequirementsManager extends Object
This class controls the modification and creation of many projects.
Author:
yujim

    • projects

      public ArrayList<Project> projects
      List of projects

    • currentProject

      public Project currentProject
      The current project

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static RequirementsManager getInstance()
      This method will check if the singleton for this class is null. If so, then it will call the private RequirementsManager() constructor to create the single instance of this class.
      Returns:
      instance the singleton instance of the RequirementsManager class

    • saveCurrentProjectToFile

      public void saveCurrentProjectToFile(String filename)
      Write the Project to the file specified by the parameter using the ProjectWriter class. If the currentProject is null or if there are no UserStorys in the currentProject an IllegalArgumentException should be thrown.
      Parameters:
      filename - name of the file to write the project to
      Throws:
      IOException - if unable to save file
      IllegalArgumentException - if the currentProject is null or if there are no UserStorys in the currentProject

    • loadProjectsFromFile

      public void loadProjectsFromFile(String filename)
      Uses the ProjectReader to read the given fileName. The returned list of Projects are added to the projects field. The first project in the list returned from ProjectReader is made the currentProject.
      Parameters:
      filename - name of the file to read from

    • createNewProject

      public void createNewProject(String projectname)
      Creates a new Project with the given name and adds it to the end of the projects list. The project is then loaded as the currentProject by calling the loadProject(String projectName) method. An IllegalArgumentException is thrown if the projectName parameter is null, empty string, or a duplicate of an existing project name (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      projectname - name of the newly created project
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if projectName is null, an empty string, or a duplicate of an already existing project name (case-insensitive).

    • loadProject

      public void loadProject(String projectname)
      Finds the Project with the given name in the list, makes it the active or currentProject, and sets the user story id for that project so that any new UserStorys added to the project are created with the next correct id.
      Parameters:
      projectname - name of project to find

    • getUserStoriesAsArray

      public String[][] getUserStoriesAsArray()
      Returns a 2D Object array that is used to populate the UserStoryTableModel (inner class of the RequirementsManagerGUI.UserStoryListPanel) with information.
      Returns:
      array 2D array used to populate the UserStoryTableModel with information

    • getUserStoryById

      public UserStory getUserStoryById(int id)
      Returns the UserStory in the list with the given id. If there is no UserStory with that id, the method returns null.
      Parameters:
      id - id to match with the UserStory in the list
      Returns:
      the UserStory with the matching id, or null if there are no matching UserStories

    • deleteUserStoryById

      public void deleteUserStoryById(int id)
      Removes the UserStory with the given id from the list.
      Parameters:
      id - given id to match with the UserStory in the list

    • executeCommand

      public void executeCommand(int id, Command c)
      Finds the UserStory with the given id and updates it by passing in the given Command.
      Parameters:
      id - given id to match with the UserStory in the list
      c - command to give to the found UserStory

    • addUserStoryToProject

      public void addUserStoryToProject(String title, String user, String action, String value)
      Creates a new UserStory with the given parameters in the submitted state and adds it to the project list
      Parameters:
      title - story's title
      user - story's user information
      action - story's action information
      value - story's value information

    • getProjectName

      public String getProjectName()
      Returns the project name for the currentProject. If the currentProject is null, then null is returned.
      Returns:
      returns the project name, or null if the name is null

    • getProjectList

      public String[] getProjectList()
      Returns a String array of project names in the order they are listed in the projects list. This is used by the GUI to populate the project drop down.
      Returns:
      names String array of project names as listed in the projects list
